column4: there is no entry in fstab for the cd - and the rules for making one have changed in natty
generally you dont want an entry in fstab, leave it out and gnome-volume-manager should auto-mount the partition
in the previous version you stuck in a cd and it mounted - natty doesnt
what is the output of groups?
the ownership of cdrom in media is root root
i would remove the folder in /media, remove the entry from fstab and if that doesn't work try udisks --monitor-detail
very interesting - it sees it but there was never an entry in fstab - isnt that required
no you DONT want an entry in fstab. the existence of an entry in fstab tells the userspace mounting daemon that you want to manage the mountpoint and NOT to automout it
i think your problem was the existence of a folder in /media with the name of the mountpoint it would have chosen, but with root ownership
it will make its own folder. i think the presence of that folder is confusing it
no significant behavior here - maybe I should reboot
that shows activity when I eject the disk only - nothing when I put it in
well thats the problem. not sure how to fix it though
what is normal for natty? should it be mounting the cd
well it should be detecting the insertion, which generates events in udisk and that triggers mounting or the media player popup depending on what kind of disk
it was a hardware prob - 2 dif brands of ide/sata converter orient opposite to each other
